data.text: For more information on visitor restrictions, health facilities screening, and to access the health facility exemption form, head to: https://t.co/sCX3TPjwU6

This will ensure we limit numbers in these areas. The exemption form will also provide more information about what visitors will need to do before they visit their loved one, including doing a rapid-antigen test.

It is important to remember that visitor restrictions remain at two people per day but only one person at a time.
Those wanting to visit the Canberra Region Cancer Centre, 14A, 14B, 10A and 4B will need to apply for a health facility exemption.

While masks are no longer mandatory in certain indoor settings across the ACT, they will still be a requirement of entry into high-risk settings, including hospitals and health care facilities. This is to ensure your safety and that of our patients and staff.

These locations will have hand sanitiser for visitors to use and surgical masks for them to wear. Visitors must also continue to complete the ACT health facilities screening tool, and receive a green tick, before entering.
